intro: Cirsium simplex subsp. armenum, commonly known as Armenian thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and parts of Turkey. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring dark green, lance-shaped leaves with spiny margins and a rough texture. The plant produces purple to pinkish-purple flower heads, which are composed of numerous small florets arranged in a cylindrical shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and naturalized areas.
